file_content.text: Let's see the Republic try to get in here now.
It's over. The reactor is secure, but you'll need someone to run it.
Good, good. I arranged for a contingency such as this.
Command is sending technicians and guards on the next shuttle down.
It's over. The reactor is secure, and the Empire now has a deal with the Ortolans.
I was hoping they'd stay on. The last time we took over a reactor, we had to translate all their labels into Basic.
I'll ask Command to send reinforcements there.
Looks like we're going to be holding some ground after all.
This planet should be about winning instead of stalemates.
Good.
Yes, who knows, maybe others will follow in your footsteps.
If you say so, my lord.
I'm fond of the exhaustion strategy myself. We've cost the Republic ten times what we're worth.
But let's not talk theory when the real world demands our attention. The captain of Thesh Outpost on the glacier requires help.
Let's move on.
We require no further assistance, but I would like to ask a personal favor.
The captain of Thesh Outpost on the glacier is what you might call a friend. We went through the Academy together.
You said pirate outposts are hooked up to the reactor. What happens to them?
And the pirates?
We cut their power and watch them run to a shelter with heat. They're easy pickings then.
But such trifles are our duty, not yours. You would be more useful at Thesh Outpost, on the glacier. The captain there is a friend.
He's been wounded, and his outpost is battling a group of survivalist fanatics called the Hailstorm Brotherhood. You could make the difference.
I'll go at once.
Done.
Excellent. I'll send word.
We'll see.
That is as much as I can ask. We must all look out for ourselves.
I have other matters in mind.
My obligations come first.
I see. Well, too much to be hoped for, I suppose.
If you'll excuse me, I need to go check on the installation process for our guns. Good day.
Hurry! They're setting bombs in the reactor!
We've already begun the installation of our defense systems, and we're on schedule to be done before nightfall.
Sir? The Republic frequencies are alive with chatter.
They somehow knew we had a power surge just now, so I swept for bugs, and I found this: an energy monitor.
Do we have a spy or a traitor?
Someone's been in the base?
Based on the Republic's internal communications, they had this installed long before we took over this outpost.
I only looked because the Republic chatter was so obviously shocked by the influx of power.
Interesting.
The key thing is, they saw our power readouts and were shocked into action. And that's not good.
So they know about our new power source. What good will it do them?
I'm not impressed.
They'll look to cut us off at the root.
They won't attack here; they'll bomb the main geothermal reactor to black out the entire sector.
Do you agree that's the most likely target?
Does that make sense, Captain?
If the grid goes cold, it'll get rid of all the pirates plugged into it, too. It's a solid win for the Republic.
You've got my attention.
It sounds like they figure with us and a lot of pirates all on the same grid, one fatal blow is better than trying to take the reactor over.
They'll have to cut through the Ortolan workers there and the White Maw pirates, but they're sending Zero Squad snowtroopers.
How well-defended is this reactor?
Can they do it?
It's an Ortolan community that keeps the mechanics running, and they won't put up much resistance.
They're too used to knuckling under the White Maw pirates there. But the Republic is sending snowtroopers from Zero Squad.
If I were a gambler like the captain here, I'd bet on them.
Do not bet so hastily. I will put a stop to this.
I'll take over the reactor.
Very good, my lord.
My name alone will destroy them.
They don't have long to live.
Yes, uh, I'm sure your confidence will serve you well, my lord.
Put a bounty on their heads, and you'll have them soon enough.
Give me a price.
Good. I thought you'd see it my way.
If the installation is so key, I'll go myself.
Well, we can't have that.
It's central to our functioning, and the White Maw's. They aren't allies, but if they're stirred up, it's trouble for everyone.
But concentrate on Zero Squad. They're the best cold-weather troopers the Republic has. Any defeat will humiliate them.
Then I should go quickly.
Zero Squad is the Republic's best. If you defeat them, just think of the humiliation.
Could someone explain to me why we aren't in control of this reactor to begin with?
I don't believe this.
Part of the big Hoth plan. We were told to be efficient, and living on a small generator or your enemy's fuel is plenty efficient.
But this is something new. The Republic destroying the reactor rather than capturing it--they're learning to fight like us.
All the more reason to humiliate them by taking out Zero Squad--let them see their heroes die.
You did it. We're running on geothermal power now. We blew a circuit when it came on, but that was easily fixed.
Did the Houks prove difficult?
They proved clumsy and stupid. I could have fought twice that number.
Not for me.
It's odd none of you are injured given their accuracy. But I won't refuse good news.
I thought as much. Sith have an extremely high success rate in combat against irregular forces.
I thought as much. The White Maw have a good kill ratio versus regular troops, but nonstandard tactics like yours eat them up.
They would have killed me if I let them. I believe a "thank you" is in order.
Yes... now show some respect.
I'm sorry, I thought it went without saying that everyone in this base owes you a debt.
Yes, and it's time I was paid.
I don't believe we discussed credits... but if that's the price for the outpost's survival, we can accommodate you.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to oversee the deployment of our sensors and weapons.
If you can stomp out those Houks and power the guns, our odds go up to fifty-fifty at least.
What is this? I asked not to be disturbed.
No matter. It is a rare sight to see a stranger here, let alone more than one. I trust you have come to help.
Ah, it is you. Commander Tritan and that Chiss fellow spoke well of you. Make yourself at home.
Ah, my apologies, my lord. I did not see it was you.
Forgive me. I have had enough of interruptions today. You are, of course, welcome.
I was busy calculating our chances in case the Republic attacks. It looks grim. If they bring a force of any real size, we're doomed.
Don't focus on possibilities. Focus on what we will do.
Control your own destiny.
The best force multiplier would be installing more automated guns--which we have. However, they eat power.
If you have enemies, send me at them. You will be safe soon enough.
Not with me here.
Our skeleton crew is willing to fight, but we need automated guns to make up for the lack of numbers. And those eat power.
Troubling.
That's an understatement. We're understaffed, Dorn Base can't send us reinforcements, and our automated turrets eat too much power.
What we really need is to tap into the nearby geothermal power substation, but it's been taken by the White Maw.
We don't have the manpower to take on those pirates, and we've got a base that'll black out in any sustained fight with the Republic.
Criminals are no threat to me, frozen ones less so.
I'll kill the pirates.
The White Maw's Houks are more like an army than criminals. Our kill ratio for them is about one to ten.
I've never heard of Imperials backing down from a fight with pirates.
Pirates too tough for you?
They're Houks, part of a group called the White Maw--two and a half meters of muscle each.
The last time they captured our men, they made them dig their graves in the ice using only their hands. Then they buried them alive.
I couldn't chance that happening again, so we haven't attacked their power substation. But you... your odds look good.
How do you know you can't kill them? Have you tried?
You're sure you'd fail?
I've run mathematical models on a few battle scenarios, and the numbers don't look good.
We stand less than a six percent chance to clear the Houks off the substation without drastic casualties.
And the chance for capture or total loss is in the mid-thirties. That's far too high. You, on the other hand... your odds look good.
I can take out these monstrosities.
I will go.
I have no doubt of that. But you will need this energy coupling to restore the flow back toward the outpost.
These vagabonds will see what power truly is.
I will go.
Of that I am certain. But take this energy coupling with you. You'll need it to switch the flow back toward the outpost.
Install it when you have eliminated all resistance.
A pirate is a pirate. I've dealt with their kind before.
I will go.
I won't lose sleep over dead Houks. Now, you'll need this energy coupling to divert power back to us.
I can get in there with no one being the wiser. Getting out... I make no promises.
I will go.
You'll have to eliminate large numbers of them. They would certainly notice if you hooked up our energy coupling again.
Take this and install it when you've eliminated all resistance.
I've gambled on my future before, but rarely have I seen the math.
If you think I can win, sure.
My method has flaws, to be sure, but the soldiers here don't like to bet against me. Let me give you what you'll need.
I could do it, but in a Republic attack, they will cut your power first.
But your goal is flawed.
You mean like at Dorn Base? We've thought of that. Once it's ours, half of our turrets will be installed to cover the power substation.
This is an energy coupling you'll need to install when you've eliminated all resistance. It should divert flow back to the outpost.
With that power, our guns will be operational and give us a fighting chance. Go in strength.
Number crunching won't convince me to take a fool's errand.
No way. [Refuse quest]
If that's how you see it, I won't change your mind.
I am assessing the situation. Leave me.
